page.title: 09Pitchcombe
page.content: Pitchcombe is a village off the Stroud-Gloucester road.With the hills above thickly wooded,it is the most attractive village in the whole area. A castle,which used to stand in the village but was demolished as long ago as 1155,may have connections with Wragg castle which is a fine old stone house,previously known as Ragged Castle Farm.Resthaven House of Healing was founded by Miss Maud Caruthers Little and dedicated in 1938. Pitchcombe is one of the sleepy hollow villages.In 1983 when gales left a trail of damage,fallen trees blocked the roads and brought down power lines,but services were restored whithin hours.The well-kept road-side Church,made new in the last century,is still ringing the same bell which was rung centuries ago and yew trees guard the church's entrance.
